verses.verse: Yet, if you warn the wicked, and he does not turn from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; (Is. 49:4, 5; Ezek. 14:14, 20; Acts 18:6; 20:26; 1 Tim. 4:16) but you have delivered your soul.

“Again, when a (Ps. 125:5; Ezek. 18:24; 33:18; Zeph. 1:6) righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, and I lay a stumbling block before him, he shall die; because you did not give him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteousness which he has done shall not be remembered; but his blood I will require at your hand.
Nevertheless if you warn the righteous man that the righteous should not sin, and he does not sin, he shall surely live because he took warning; also you will have delivered your soul.”
(Ezek. 1:3) Then the hand of the LORD was upon me there, and He said to me, “Arise, go out (Ezek. 8:4) into the plain, and there I shall talk with you.”

So I arose and went out into the plain, and behold, (Ezek. 1:28; Acts 7:55) the glory of the LORD stood there, like the glory which I (Ezek. 1:1) saw by the River Chebar; (Ezek. 1:28) and I fell on my face.
Then (Ezek. 2:2) the Spirit entered me and set me on my feet, and spoke with me and said to me: “Go, shut yourself inside your house.
And you, O son of man, surely (Ezek. 4:8) they will put ropes on you and bind you with them, so that you cannot go out among them.

(Ezek. 24:27; Luke 1:20, 22) I will make your tongue cling to the roof of your mouth, so that you shall be mute and (Hos. 4:17; Amos 8:11) not be one to rebuke them, (Ezek. 2:5-7) for they are a rebellious house.

(Ex. 4:11, 12; Ezek. 24:27; 33:22) But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall say to them, (Ezek. 3:11) ‘Thus says the Lord GOD.’ He who hears, let him hear; and he who refuses, let him refuse; for they are a rebellious house.
The Siege of Jerusalem Portrayed “You also, son of man, take a clay tablet and lay it before you, and portray on it a city, Jerusalem.
(Jer. 6:6; Ezek. 21:22) Lay siege against it, build a (2 Kin. 25:1) siege wall against it, and heap up a mound against it; set camps against it also, and place battering rams against it all around.

Moreover take for yourself an iron plate, and set it as an iron wall between you and the city. Set your face against it, and it shall be (Jer. 39:1, 2; Ezek. 5:2) besieged, and you shall lay siege against it. (Ezek. 12:6, 11; 24:24, 27) This will be a sign to the house of Israel.
“Lie also on your left side, and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it. According to the number of the days that you lie on it, you shall bear their iniquity.
For I have laid on you the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days; (Num. 14:34) so you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
And when you have completed them, lie again on your right side; then you shall bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days. I have laid on you a day for each year.
“Therefore you shall set your face toward the siege of Jerusalem; your arm shall be uncovered, and you shall prophesy against it.
(Ezek. 3:25) And surely I will restrain you so that you cannot turn from one side to another till you have ended the days of your siege.
